Body: Billy can play 24 songs in his music book. He knows the names of 18 different guitar chords. Billy's music book has 52 songs in it.
Question: How many songs does Billy still need to learn?

Body: Gwen prepared ninety-eight books to sell in the flea market. After the activity ended she had ninety-six books left.
Question: How many did she sell?

Body: Mom made 32 chocolate chip cookies. It took 24 minutes to mix the ingredients and 16 minutes to bake. Julie and Matt ate 9 cookies after dinner.
Question: How many cookies were left?

Body: A chef had seventy-seven cherries. If he used sixty of them to make a pie,
Question: how many cherries would he still have?

Body: There are 45 questions on the math test. 17 questions are word problems. 28 questions are addition and subtraction problems. Steve can only answer 38 questions.
Question: How many questions did Steve leave blank?

Body: Isabel had ninety DS games. If she gave eighty-seven to her friend,
Question: how many would she have left?

Body: Kendra learns 12 new spelling words each week. Her goal is to learn 60 new words before her eighth birthday. She has already learned 36 new words.
Question: How many more words does Kendra need to learn?

Body: A store has thirty-five shirts. If they sold thirty of them,
Question: how many shirts would they have?

Body: Tripp and Charlotte are going on a 36 mile hike. Tripp's backpack weighs 25 pounds. Charlotte's back pack weighs 7 pounds less. They hiked 9 miles the first day.
Question: How many miles do they have left?

Body: Adam picked thirty-five strawberries. After eating some, he had thirty-three left.
Question: How many strawberries did Adam eat?

Body: Dora is having her tenth birthday party next Saurday. She invited 64 people. Her mom ordered 36 sandwiches. 16 people can not come to the party.
Question: How many people will be at Dora's party?

Body: At the zoo a cage had sixty-eight snakes. If forty-two were hiding,
Question: how many snakes were not hiding?

Body: Diane wants to buy a package of cookies. The cookies cost 65 cents. Diane has 27 cents.
Question: How much more money does she need?

Body: A pet store had eighty-five gerbils. If they sold sixty-nine of them,
Question: how many would they have left?

Body: Andy had 31 baseball cards. His dad gave him some more. Then Andy had 50 baseball cards.
Question: How many baseball cards did Andy get from his dad?

Body: There are 22 dogs in the farm. They live in 5 dog-houses equally.
Question: How many dogs are there in each dog-house?

Body: A tourist group has 26 people. At a hotel, they want to rent some large rooms for 3 people each and some small rooms for 2 each. In order to rent the least number of rooms and have every room fully occupied,
Question: how many large rooms should be rented?

Body: Divide 39 balloons into 7 equal groups.
Question: How many balloons are there in each group?

Body: A ballet class wants to divide its 90 members into some large groups at 7 members each and some small groups at 3 members each. In order to make the least number of groups,
Question: how many large groups should be made?

Body: The school bought 54 basketballs and distribute them into 7 classes equally.
Question: How many basketballs did each class get?

Body: There are 32 students in the class. The teacher divided them into 5 equal groups.
Question: How many students are there in each group?

Body: Tyler, an animal rights advocate, decided to build his own animal sanctuary to protect different animals from poachers. The sanctuary was divided into different regions. The first region to be built was a bird sanctuary. Initially, he had 29 endangered bird species on that region. If each species has 7 pairs of birds,
Question: how many pairs does he have in total?

Body: Paul was packing up his old toys. He managed to squeeze eight toys into a box. If Paul filled up four boxes,
Question: how many toys did he pack total?

Body: Another region was the aquatic reserve for freshwater organisms. If there are 6 bodies of water in the region, each having 175 different fishes,
Question: how many fishes does he have in total?

Body: Adam could fit nine action figures on each shelf in his room. His room has three shelves.
Question: How many action figures total could his shelves hold?

Body: He also had 8 aquariums for saltwater animals. Each aquarium has 64 animals in it.
Question: How many saltwater animals does Tyler have?

Body: An airline lets each passenger take eight pieces of luggage. If there were four people flying,
Question: how many bags could they take?

Body: The sanctuary also includes several swamp areas where most of the reptiles usually reside. If there are 4 swamps, each having 356 different reptiles,
Question: how many reptiles are living in the swamp areas?

Body: Maria was placing her spare change into stacks. Each stack had three coins. If she had five stacks,
Question: how many coins did she have?

Body: There are 3 more sections that are undeveloped. Each of the remaining sections has a land area of 2435 square feet.
Question: What is the total area of the undeveloped land?

Body: Luke was helping his mom wash clothes. They washed six loads with seven towels in each load.
Question: How many towels did they wash total?

Body: It's Rachel's birthday. Her parents wanted her to have fun so they went to the circus that happened to be in town that day. Upon arriving at the circus, they went to the ticket booth and asked how much each ticket cost. If each ticket costs $44.00 and they bought 7 tickets,
Question: how much money did they spend on tickets?

Body: Larry's Lawn Care charges nine bucks to trim a hedge. If Henry has three hedges,
Question: how much money would he spend?

Body: They entered the circus tent and saw that there are four seating sections for the audience. If each section can accommodate 246 people,
Question: how many people can the tent accommodate in total?

Body: Paul was reading through his favorite book series. Each week he read four different books.
Question: How many books would he have read through after five weeks?

Body: The first act included 5 clown mobiles, each stuffed with 28 clowns.
Question: How many clowns are inside all the clown mobiles combined?

Body: A group of 8 friends were dressing as pirates for Halloween. If each costume cost 5 dollars,
Question: how much did they spend?

Question: how many balls are needed if there are 378 jugglers putting a show at the same time?

Body: Kale was drawing on scrap paper. He could fit 5 drawings on each page. If he has 6 pages,
Question: how many drawings can he make?

Body: For the final act, the circus brought out dancing animals wearing crowns. If each crown is made with 7 different colored feathers,
Question: how many feathers are needed for 934 crowns?

Body: For Bianca's birthday 5 of her friends gave her 6 dollars.
Question: How much money did she get for her birthday?

Body: Amanda and her friends decided to go to an amusement park for the weekend. The nearest amusement park from their city is Super Fun-tastic Land. If they cover a distance of 27 miles for every hour of travel and they travelled for 3 hours,
Question: how far is SFL from the city?

Question: how many tickets would they need?

Question: how many people in total are waiting to get in?

Body: Nancy was buying soap for her bathroom. She bought 6 packs with each pack having 5 bars.
Question: How many bars of soap did she buy?

Question: how far is HappyLand from SFL?

Question: How many towels did she buy?

Question: how much did they spend on tickets?

Question: how many pieces of clothing could it hold?

Question: how many pages will Jack need to go through if he plans to read them all?

Question: how many friends can she invite?

Question: How many pages does the encyclopedia have in total?

Body: The mini library also has a section for the classics. If Jack has a collection of 6 classic authors, with each author having 33 books,
Question: how many books does he have in the classics section?

Body: Diane wants to buy a package of cookies. The cookies cost 65 cents. Diane has 27 cents.
Question: What's the difference between the cost of the cookies and the money of Diane?

Question: What's the difference between the number of chairs before selling and the left?

Question: What's the difference between the number of all questions on the math test and the number of questions that Steve can answer?

Question: What's the difference between the number of apples Zoe picked and now the tree has?

Question: What's the difference between the number of Billy's tickets he won and he had the left after buying yoyo?

Question: What's the difference between the number of balloons the clown had in the beginning and he gave away at a party?

Question: what's the difference between the pounds of Frank's candy before he gave Nancy and he gave to?

Question: What's the difference between of the pieces of candy Amy gave away and the left?

Question: What's the difference between Billy's points and his friend's points?

Question: What's the difference between the number of hotdogs before selling and after selling?

Question: What's the difference between the number of dollars when Maria got and left the fair?
